cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi west of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico, then turning northwest/west-northwest toward the northern Gulf Coast with a bend toward east-Texas after landfall
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Lake Borgne and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Watch: Intracoastal City LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border including New Orleans; Tropical Storm Watch: Mississippi/Alabama border to Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the Texas-Louisiana border eastward through Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (34-kt) are possible Tuesday into Wednesday with a peak probability of about 32%. Chance of 50-kt winds is low (≤9%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge heights of 2–4 ft are forecast from Sabine Pass eastward; west of Sabine Pass toward Galveston any surge should stay below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain are possible with localized amounts up to 4 inches as the system draws nearer Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast beginning late Monday.
